clinical_study.brief_title: What is the Incidence of an Immune Disorder in Children With Invasive Pneumococcal Disease (IPD)?
clinical_study.official_title: What is the Incidence of an Immune Disorder in Children With Invasive Pneumococcal Disease (IPD)? A Prospective Cohort Study.

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multicentre prospective audit to determine the incidence of immunodeficiency in children with IPD.
Aims and/or research question of the project
1. To determine the incidence of primary immunodeficiency in children >2 years who present with IPD
2. To determine the types of immunodeficiency associated with IPD in children

primary_outcome.measure: incidence of primary immunodeficiency in children who present with invasive pneumococcal disease
primary_outcome.description: This will be picked up upon prospective immunological testing, after identification of patients with invasive pneumococcal disease. A series of tests will be performed depending on the clinical opinion of the immunology team. Such tests may include lymphocyte subsets, complement function, serum immunoglobulin levels, memory B cells, vaccine antibody responses, etc.

primary_outcome.measure: types of immunodeficiency associated with children who present with invasive pneumococcal disease
primary_outcome.description: This will be determined based on the testing performed by the immunologists.

secondary_outcome.measure: whether increased referrals of children who present with invasive pneumococcal disease for investigation of primary immunodeficiency facilitates early detection
secondary_outcome.description: This information will come from reviewing the case series of patients who are identified from this study. The incidence of those with primary immunodeficiency will be analysed against known background rates of diagnoses.

arm_group.description: Children with IPD will be referred for immunological evaluation. The protocol for immune work up will be the same but between centres there is variation in the age criteria for referral i.e. >2 years in some, >6 months in others.

intervention.description: Screening for primary immunodeficiency and splenic dysfunction

study_pop.textblock:
Children presenting with invasive pneumococcal disease at any of the participating sites listed.
Invasive pneumococcal disease is defined by isolation by culture or PCR of Streptococcus pneumoniae from sterile sites including blood, cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), joint fluid or pleural fluid. In those patients with bacteraemia, their presentation needs to be accompanied by signs of sepsis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children aged 0 to 18 years admitted to one of the six centres with IPD.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children who do not fulfil the age criteria for immunological evaluation at that particular site e.g. aged <2 years at Royal Children's Hospital.
- Children with a known underlying condition predisposing to IPD i.e. nephrotic syndrome.
